text: Islamic law has the concept of marriage called Nikah (نكاح). Normal marriages do not end, unless they are divorced. In addition, there is a marriage for a given time, called Nikah Mut'ah. Sunni Islam does not recognize Nikah Mut'ah; they say it is a legitimisation of prostitution. Despite this, some Sunni schools of law have developed similar concepts. In Nikah, both husband and wife are asked three times for consent. The consent of the bride is compulsory in Islam. Category:Islamic law Category:Marriage
title: Nikah
